title: Automated Alert: 05-12-1990
body:
ALERT: 
(8) Tau level temporal events detected in Region IN13, immediate action required!

title: Automated Alert: 04-13-1987
body:
ALERT: 
(4) Tau level temporal events detected in Region IN13, immediate action required!

title: Automated Alert: 01-21-1974
body:
ALERT: 
(2) Tau level temporal events detected in Region IN13, immediate action required!

title: Automated Alert: 06-26-1972
body:
ALERT: 
(1) Tau level temporal events detected in Region IN13, immediate action required!

title: Re: CODE BLACK: IN13
body: Rescinding the Code Black under authority of Site Director William Baker, identification passphrase "bubblegum tree". The breach alarm was a false positive, the site requires no assistance at this time.

title: CODE BLACK: IN13
body:
ALERT: A containment breach has been reported from Site IN13, suggesting the escape of an NTT. 
Staff and security are advised to avoid confrontation with the NTT at all costs. Do not engage fire on the NTT unless it has been proven to slow/hinder the advance of the threat.
 An MTF team will be dispatched to your location shortly.

title: Research Update: Project Temporis
body:
Agent Johnson,

I hope this email finds you well. Project Temporis is showing great promise and we have been able to gather a substantial amount of data on the artifact's capabilities.

As per our discussions, I understand your concerns regarding the potential consequences of using the artifact. However, I assure you that we have taken every precaution to ensure the safety of our researchers.

Please let me know if there are any further updates or developments that you would like to share.

        William Baker

title: Re: Research Update: Project Temporis
body:
Director Baker,

I received your email and I appreciate the update on Project Temporis. However, I must express my increasing concerns about the safety protocols in place.

Reports from the field indicate that there have been some time fluctuations during our tests with the artifact. While these fluctuations have not yet caused any harm, I believe that it is important for us to consider the potential consequences of these disruptions.

I strongly suggest that we reassess the potential risks involved and take appropriate measures to minimize any potential harm.

Sarah Johnson

title: Re: Re: Research Update: Project Temporis
body:
Agent Johnson,

I have reviewed your concerns and I understand your worries. However, I must emphasize that these fluctuations are minor and well within acceptable parameters.

Our researchers have been able to effectively control the artifact and the data we are gathering is proving to be invaluable. I believe that the benefits of continuing the research far outweigh any potential risks.

Please trust in our researchers' abilities to handle the situation and let them continue their work.

William Baker

title: Re: Re: Re: Research Update: Project Temporis
body:
Director Baker,

With all due respect, I must stress that the fluctuations we are seeing with the artifact are not minor and are growing in intensity. It is imperative that we take immediate action to halt the research until we can fully assess the situation and address any potential hazards.

If you'll pardon my language sir, I have seen much shit over the course of my time here. I have seen the consequences of unchecked use of powerful artifacts like this and I implore you to listen to my concerns.

I am available to discuss this further and provide any additional information necessary.

Sarah Johnson
